title: Distribution Shape Gallery
description: An interactive infographic showing three types of distribution shapes (unimodal, bimodal, and uniform) with real-world examples, hover tooltips, click-to-enlarge views, and a quiz mode for self-assessment. Students learn to identify key characteristics of each distribution type.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Statistics
Data Visualization
Distribution Shapes
AP Statistics

educational.learningObjective: Students will identify characteristics of unimodal, bimodal, and uniform distributions

controls.name: Shuffle Examples
controls.description: Randomly selects different real-world examples for each distribution type and regenerates histogram visualizations

controls.name: Quiz Mode
controls.description: Toggles quiz mode where students identify which distribution type matches a given real-world example

interactions.description: Shows tooltip with 2-3 additional real-world examples
Opens enlarged view with larger histogram and all 5 examples listed
